description: Filecoin Orbit Kenya catalyzed decentralized storage adoption across Kenya through 10 strategic meetups and workshops (physical and virtual) from November 2024 to September 2025. We educated developers, researchers, and entrepreneurs on leveraging Filecoin's infrastructure for real-world applications—from decentralized storage solutions to AI-powered dApps. Through hands-on workshops and collaborative events with partner communities, we built a vibrant ecosystem of over 1070 participants, fostering technical expertise and innovation. Our initiatives bridged the knowledge gap, enabling Kenyan developers to contribute meaningfully to the global Filecoin network while addressing local data sovereignty and storage challenges.
end_user:
1. Web2 to Web3 Developers & Builders
Developers transitioning from traditional tech gained hands-on experience with Filecoin Virtual Machine (FVM), decentralized storage, and AI-powered dApps through our workshops. Collaborations with ecosystem projects like Lilypad Network provided practical integration knowledge, enabling them to build next-generation decentralized applications.
2. Blockchain Entrepreneurs & Startups
African entrepreneurs exploring decentralized infrastructure solutions benefited from understanding how Filecoin can address local challenges like data sovereignty, affordable storage, and reliable compute resources. Our community provided market insights, technical guidance, and networking opportunities to launch Web3 ventures.
3. Researchers & Academic Institutions
University researchers and students gained exposure to cutting-edge decentralized storage and compute technologies. Through our educational initiatives, they learned to leverage Filecoin for research data management, collaborative projects, and exploring blockchain applications relevant to African contexts—building the next generation of Web3 innovators.
impressions:
